website_summaries.verdict: Modeled after the Timberland original yellow boot, this boot  has added teddy fleece lining for extra warmth and comfort.
pros: Waterproof membrane is sure to keep feet dry and comfortable in any weather
Lace-up ankle boot featuring fold-over shaft with fleece lining
Rubber lug outsole provides durability and traction on any surface
EVA midsole offers all-day comfort and cushioning
cons: Boot weight is on the heavy side

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I got them in wheat, and they look amazing! You can see the great quality. Very happy with them, and the speed of shipping! 😍
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: The quality of these boots is great! Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these boots is great! Comfortable, yet solid and durable. A lot of compliments. I went with gray because I'm one of those people that doesn't like pairing black and brown so grey seems like a good compromise. The boots don't look true to color on amazon's site but in person they are a medium-dark standard grey which I was pleased with. Some people said the ankle was not roomy enough or that they were too narrow, which concerned me, but they fit perfectly! So happy I went with these boots. I didn't see a pic of the boot bottom on here so I've included one so you can see it has substantial traction.
customer_reviews.author: Megan T.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: My usual shoe size is 7.5... but I usually buy boots in size 8 to give room for thick socks and such. The 8 was a good fit for me
customer_reviews.author: A_me_A

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Very stiff, thin, NOT warm. The lining is thin and the top does NOT fold down. The lining is so thin that when it is folded down it looks like you forgot to tie your boot up. I bought two sizes based on reviews; 8 B and 8 wide. Both are awful! The shoes feel like they are made from cardboard and the toes are so hard that it's like they are made for construction work except that they would NEVER withstand the rigors of working, not even walking. I don't think these were really made my Timberland. Seem like mock-ups to me. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Gramja

customer_reviews.title: Clunky, uncomfortable, and not feminine.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are super hard, actually rigid; they have no arch support and are extremely heavy. The foot bed is not lined, only the upper portion of the boot. These do not look like women's shoes at all. My granddaughter hated them and was adamant she would not wear them. I returned these the day after receiving them. I would not recommend, especially at $130+
customer_reviews.author: ilookfamous

customer_reviews.title: in pic they look like they fall down like a soft leather would to ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received ... so far not impressed.. very stiff an run small.. I always wear 61/2 and they are very snug.. I’ll have to wear thin socks.. in pic they look like they fall down like a soft leather would to wear with the fleas showing as pictured; when in fact not possible without lots of wear I’m sure.. when I walk they squeak!!!! Dang! I bought these to wear tomorrow so I’m going to... hmmmm not happy for the $$$$$ buyers remorse. 😒
customer_reviews.author: russ

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter casual office wear or winter work boots.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so nice. The first pair arrived with a large cut in the leather and were returned but this pair have been great. I bought them for my wife and she loves them. They are very warm and waterproof. She uses them for casual Fridays because they look so nice that she can't bear the thought of getting them dirty. Having said that, these would be awesome winter work boots for any woman out there. the insoles are well cushioned and have good arch support and as I said the are waterproof and according to my who always has cold feet, they are exceptionally warm.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Doran

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worn them yet but they are true to size for me. A lil narrow, but they do offer the med/wide ones as well. I'm usually anywhere from 8-9. Bought an 8.5 and fit perfect. Kinda stiff but hopefully they break in some. I bought the camel color. Only 4/5 bc of the narrow toe, might take awhile to break in, Update 1/5/17 The stitching has begun to unwravel on one boot in two different areas :( took away a star
customer_reviews.author: JeepHairDontCare

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good looking boots!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 8.5 sometimes 9, these boots in 8.5 fit fine. A little tight at first but I'm pretty sure they'll get comfy with wearing. The glazed ginger color is awesome, I couldn't decide btw burgundy n ginger at first because both look good but I knew there'll be color variance and if burgundy goes wrong it'll definitely look completely different so I played safe with ginger n it turned out to be very nice. The fleece looks adorable when you fold them down a little bit and they go with most of casual wear. This is my first Timberland and I can't wait to wear them in colder places!
customer_reviews.author: Janette Li

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure that these shoes are original. I read all the reviews, and decided to buy them. And now I'm in love with these shoes) This is 100% original. Very comfortable and beautiful. And the price is just super cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... boots for a living and these are just as comfortable. Takes a little breaking in but perfect for ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear combat boots for a living and these are just as comfortable. Takes a little breaking in but perfect for keeping my toes warm in the winter. Always loved Timberlands as my go-to boots. Love the tread for walking on slippery ice and several inches of snow. Adjustable size and flaps are good for style variances. I prefer the military jump boots look and lace them all the way up with my pants tucked in.
customer_reviews.author: lumpsAlot

customer_reviews.title: Review & Advice
customer_reviews.text: They are more of a fashion statement than they are for comfort but they definitely keep my feet dry. I recommend getting a half size up and they are a little narrow so maybe go for a wide. Do not use them for winter hiking or ski resorts. For walking around town they are great! If you have narrow ankles and calfs they may not fit tight enough so wear thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: Liann

customer_reviews.title: Good boots with caveat
customer_reviews.text: These boots didn't fit initially. It turned out that the insert is curled up on the sides and made the boot feel too narrow. I removed them and put in a new pair of plush wool fleece inserts that I had purchased from Amazon months ago. They fit the boot perfectly and now the boots fit my feet perfectly. I don't know why a reputable company would put such cheap insoles into their boots. I have several other pairs of Timbers and they have comfortable orthotic insoles that really enhance the boot's wearability. Anyway, I made these work for me. Otherwise, this is a nice quality boot. Beautiful leather.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wolfson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing work-boots, cute too
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots I've ever owned. They're warm, practically impervious to snow and water, have great tread and are easy to break-in. They are a bit on the heavy side, but for the durability, it's worth a little extra heft. I'm a delivery driver in the Northeast and have dropped dozens of heavy bags on myself, had doors slam shut on my toes, and have trudged through snow up to my calves to get to customers in snowstorms. These are now all I'll wear to work in the winter!
customer_reviews.author: kiratsukai

customer_reviews.title: Great grey color combo
customer_reviews.text: Great grey color combo! Fits true size. Are kind of wide for my thin feet. The extra space is good for thick wool socks. These are my first timberlands. So its no easy to get use to “heavy looking” (and kind of heavy weight boots). Could say they are “comfy”. They will with a sheepskin or gel insole (and more warmy).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... boots in the most recent Timberland catalog it was love at first sight
customer_reviews.text: When I saw these boots in the most recent Timberland catalog it was love at first sight. They were on the pricey side, but I had to have them! When I found the boots on Amazon at a reduced price I purchased them immediately. When the boots finally arrived, they were everything I expected. They look good and are very warm. A couple of things though. They are a little snug across the widest part of my foot. After a couple of more wears I believe they will loosen up. Also, I bought the dark burgundy and they were a little darker than pictured. Still Very pleased with these good quality boots!
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Nice Timberland boots.
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice pair of boots. My last pair, which lasted me a decade of common wear, was the exact same size and color, except the inside was white, thick fleece instead of the thin black layer in these. The inside feels noticeably thinner and therefore does not feel as cushiony as I hoped--which is one of the main reasons I love them. Despite this, the boots are still so nice that I am still giving it 5 stars. Also, the last boots came with a leather tag that dangled. The fleece roll down boots listed in the official Timberland website all had them too. I thought it was adorable. Why didn't I get it with this pair?
customer_reviews.author: Suki

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a 1/2 size down - glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I wear a solid 8.5 and ordered an 8 hoping that the reviews that these boots fit a little large were right. The 8 fit perfectly with a little room in the toes to wear wool socks. I plan to use them traveling to northern Europe this winter. They are a very nice wheat/taupe color that will go with black or brown.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Perfect winterboots
customer_reviews.text: Warm, good grip and you can wear the boots in different ways (eg flap up or down). Perfect for this winter weather; my feet stay warm in these fashionable boots! Material is of good quality, good leather and laces are long enough to bind together all the way at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: For active grandmother
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 80+ year old mother, who walks 1-2 hours a day, rain, shine, sleet, or hail. She had fallen on the ice last year, so I was worried her old boots did not have enough traction and her favorite tennis shoes were definitely not going to work in our severe winter weather. Although she prefers lightweight footwear, she says she feels secure in the supportive, tacky, thick soles. She loves the classic good looks and black color, which matches everything she wears. She only gripes a bit about having to point her toes to fit her foot and ankle into the boot just so, then taking some time to tighten and tie the laces up snugly.
customer_reviews.author: Clef Qian

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a warm pair of boots and couldn't pass these up. I ordered a 9.5 (I wear 9 or 9.5 in Timberland, 10 in other shoes like Nike) and am very happy with the size. I definitely have room to wear thick socks with these. I think that I would have been fine with a size 9 as well. I really love the grey and these boots look even better in person than they do in the picture. I also really like how the fleece lining goes throughout the whole boot (excluding the footbed) and not just the top of the boot. Happy and satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Love. Love. Love.
customer_reviews.text: This boots are adorable and comfortable. I wear them with jeans or leggings. I wear them S pictured, with just front folded down or the whole thing folded down. I get so many compliments on these! They also fit amazing and are so comfortable. I usually have to order a wide but these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all terrain boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing. They kept a rock climbing incident to a serious ankle sprain and inflamed tendons instead of torn ligaments or tendons. Since then there's been more rock climbing/hiking, caving, and days when my ankle's still a bit sore and I just lace them up for extra support. These things are great, durable boots. The leather really holds up. I've got scratches, gouges, scuffs. They are well worn and going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Cacey Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I got my normal size (6) and it's still pretty tight. They are definitely the amazing Timberland quality and are pretty comfortable other than being a tight. I did notice two scuffs on the toe area after only having work the shoes twice. Mind you, I'm not a person that does a lot of heavy/hard work or outdoor activities. It happened in the time span of going to class, walking around my campus a bit, and then walking home. Other than the small scuffs which aren't really a big deal I suppose, these things have been amazing so far. I can't wait to use them once Winter comes around. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ladybellabun

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise they are super comfortable and seem built to last
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 womens and i have a wide foot. I ordered a 10 because i thought they would be tight to get on in the ankle. I probably should have got a 9. The bottom part is kind of shiny, not the typical timberland material. I wished they were all the same texture. Otherwise they are super comfortable and seem built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Barber

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality pair of boots. Doesn't look too much like a fashion boot, because the fleece is on the inside, which I really love. I've never actually gotten myself good solid boots, and I am entirely happy with my purchase. They look good, and are of a good working quality. I definitely will be a Timberland fan now. Only bummer is that there wasn't the little leather tag that I was seeing on other To. But that's not too big of a deal. Overall, solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley F.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots, but they run narrow!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. The sizing is a little wonky though. I usually wear 9.5 and have slightly wide feet (usually a medium width is just fine with some breaking in). These run NARROW. I purchased a 9 due to other reviews, and the length was fine. I had to get a shoe stretcher to make these work. So worth it though. These boots are so warm and comfortable. I've worn them through some pretty rough Chicago weather this year, and they have kept my feet warm and dry. Oh, and they're not super heavy as many winter boots tend to be.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love 😍 with my new Timberland  boots 👢
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect, fits perfectly My size varies between 8 and 8 1/2 and I went for 81/2 and is perfect Not heavy or bulky, but very stylish I can’t wait to wear it dressed up and down. I’m so happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JackieDS

customer_reviews.title: and I could not love these boots more
customer_reviews.text: These are just barely a tight fit, probably because of the lining inside the boot! However, they're not uncomfortable, and I could not love these boots more. I can wear them laced up for hiking, but I can also wear them to work at our library with the top folded down. Definitely get these! They're amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: Black leather Tims
customer_reviews.text: I have had these these black waterproof Tims for about 2 months and wear them often. They're comfortable and very warm though a bit heavy in weight. My shoe size is 7.5 M but I ordered a half size larger and there is plenty of room for a cushy insole as well as Winter weight socks. I like the look of the the fleece lined collars which I fold down. The leather is slightly shiny and scuff resistant. The tread functions well. I walk through mud, wet leaves and shallow puddles with no problem. These are heavy durable boots.
customer_reviews.author: Ardent shopper

customer_reviews.title: Mildly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just got these out of the box and they look awesome. My only issue is one of the shoelaces is already messed up. The cording on the shoelace has broken leaving the string underneath exposed. I don't want to return the boots just because one shoelace is messed up, so hopefully it doesn't break soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Waited until today to write the review because today was the first snowfall. First off, I purchased these from Amazon because Timberland was out of this color. Also Amazon was cheaper. This is my first pair of Timberland boots ever, and I LOVE THEM! They are so warm, sometimes my feet are sweating at the end of the day. I wore them in the snow/slush and they are definitely waterproof. One thing I would recommend is to spray them with the special Timberland spray to prevent them from turning white after getting wet. They are comfortable, warm, sturdy, everything I wanted in a winter boot. And cute! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Collegegurl47

customer_reviews.title: This was a birthday gift for my cousin who loves ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my cousin who loves them. She lives in New York and they certainly do the job in NY winters.
customer_reviews.author: KYL

customer_reviews.title: great outside work shoes
customer_reviews.text: these are a little difficult to get on but once on the fit is great. No slipping of heels, no pinching of toes. Serves perfect for outside work. waterproof and warm just like advertised. I have been able to work outside longer and be comfortable. Accomplished more than in winters past.
customer_reviews.author: Marrette Chambers

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Although the boot runs somewhat large it is very comfortable. The fold-down aspect does not work as well as in the picture for me, though, but that does not matter. I have already covered a considerable distance in those boots and my usually sensitive feet did not once complain. I am hoping that the quality of the product (Timberland) will be confirmed: about 10 years ago I bought another Timberland boot that I still wear. The one pair we bought one year ago though had to be returned - Timberland had decided to change a material of some kind. However, because I was so happy with the 10-year-old-boot, I gave the company another try.
customer_reviews.author: Hyazinthe

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for me...
customer_reviews.text: These boots look great however just a normal 7 was too wide to the point I can not wear them even with thick socks. My feet are fairly narrow but I still think the width of these shoes are wider than most
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boot that's worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Warm, comfortable & stylish! Perfect for chilly Michigan! Got them while pregnant and was pleased with the comfort I felt wearing them daily. For anyone apprehensive about spending a little extra on a name brand boot, do not hesitate. It is worth spending a little more on a shoe that is comfortable and will provide proper support for your feet, and overall your body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The shoe fits like a glove!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying shoes online... thanks to the other reviews, I bought true to my size and I was not disappointed. I felt that the shoe fits better for me with the laces tied up all the way. It was warm and comfortable. Will update after more prolonged use.
customer_reviews.author: girlindc

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again (if I needed another pair:)
customer_reviews.text: No difficulty slipping them on the first time; warm; break in time minimal. I primarily purchased them for a good grip to walk on slushy/icy sidewalks etc, and so far, they've done a beautiful job. They're also flexible enough to drive a car normally, unlike some of the other more traditional snow boots. I do agree, if you're going to walk a fair distance, you might want to add a cushiony sole insert; the inside sole isn't uncomfortable, just somewhat stiff which might be bothersome for a long walk. For the time being, they're just fine for me; very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Baird

customer_reviews.title: Honestly they are NOT comfortable at first
customer_reviews.text: Before I wrote a review, I had to break these boots in. Honestly they are NOT comfortable at first, and it does take a little while to break in. Now that they are broken in they are MUCH more comfortable and very durable. I love the color!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the boots!! Once they are on...
customer_reviews.text: I found it difficult to put these boots on, I am thinking it could possibly be the fleece lining causing this problem and not allowing the feet to slide in comfortably, since I never had that issue with other Timberland boots that DIDN'T have the fleece lining. Once they are on, they fit as expected...comfortable and quite warm! I think if only I could have loosened the laces a bit more (which wasn't possible), to allow some extra room to slide my feet in then it wouldn't be a problem. I DO recommend these boots, they are indeed comfortable and warm...and true to size (with the exception of it being hard to slide them on with the fleece lining.)
customer_reviews.author: VictoriasPlace

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy on a rugged Timberland boot
customer_reviews.text: Daughter wanted these type boots for Christmas. Shopped all over the internet for a good deal on properly made, heavy-duty, waterproof leather boots for under $200. This pair was exactly what she wanted and made by a company known for quality workmanship. She has barely had them off since Christmas morning. Will update after a few months of snow and rain use, but they look like a very sturdy, well-made boot. Very fast shipping and competitively priced. Not crazy about buying shoes online, but in this case it worked out well and the recipient is very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michele M. Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfy and DRY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This feels so warm and it's water proof. Wore out my old short Timberland boot which did not keep my feet warm & dry. This boot can be folded for fashion statement &/or for convenience. I ordered a 1/2 size down to a 7.5. I usually wear an 8 for regular shoes.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jung

customer_reviews.title: I will be back for more!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are just as I would expect from Timberland. They look good up or folded down. I went with the wheat color and I am glad I did. And yes, they have some weight to them lots of traction for any terrain. Very comfortable and they look good left up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy H.

customer_reviews.title: As described but ankle and tongue piece sewn together
customer_reviews.text: They were as described. But the tongue was sewn into the ankle piece and did not open very wide. If they were not stitched like this I could have gotten my ankle into them. I broke my ankle this year and it is still swollen from the surgery. Just need to find a boot yo get me thru the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Ces

customer_reviews.title: Great boots - wearing for several months now
customer_reviews.text: The boots are warm and stylish - I've received several compliments. They feel broke in immediately, which is great, since normally I struggle to wear leather shoes at first in any style due to the pain of breaking them in. They have great traction and I feel confident zooming around in them. Its a nice option in the MI winter (especially this year!) to be able to lace them up high when the snow is deep. They still look cool laced to the top. Cute when rolled down too with skinny jeans, but your boot cut will easily fit over the top, even when rolled down, and not look awkward or bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Love the original camel color
customer_reviews.text: Love the original camel color, im a size 7.5, ordered same size but wide, since I plan to used it with thick socks. Fits perfect with thick socks, you might have a lot of free space with normal socks. If you plan to go with normal socks, do not go with the wide option. Very comfortable and nice insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: I got a half size bigger as recommended by other viewers and this was perfect if you ...
customer_reviews.text: They are a little stiff which is understandable. I've worn them several times and are forming to my feet; OMG, they are cozy. I got a half size bigger as recommended by other viewers and this was perfect if you want to wear a heavier sock during very cold weather. They look great with leggings or just laced all the way up under jeans. I may need to buy a pair in other colors. eek.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of timberlands, and I love them both. My first pair did not have a fleece lining, so size 9 fits fine...after reading some reviews about these running small because of the fleece, I ordered up a size to 9.5 and it worked out perfectly. These shoes do run a little narrow, but that's great for me because I have super narrow feet. I've worn them out in the snow and they keep my feet dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: meh09

customer_reviews.title: These are the real deal
customer_reviews.text: If you just want some cute little boots with that fold-over cuff "look", there are a lot of cheaper options for you. These are real, weatherproof, built to last boots that also happen to look cute with the tops folded down. I wear these for trail walking in the mountains where I live where it is slushy in the spring and fall and snowy in the winter and we have rattlesnakes in the summer. I would suggest getting a size larger if you are in doubt between two sizes. I normally wear either a 9 or a 9.5 but the 10s in this boot fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS BOOT
customer_reviews.text: Only reason why I gave it 4 stars was because it was delayed in shipping. But otherwise, I LOVE THIS BOOT!!! It's super comfy, feels very durable, good quality, real material, and great style. These will keep my feet nice and warm in the Chicago winters. I love Timberlands.
customer_reviews.author: Lieselotte

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, wore them as work boots all winter ...
customer_reviews.text: Good boots, wore them as work boots all winter and they kept my feet very warm and dry. Although I never wear them with the top half folded down, I think that looks dorky. They look good all the way up and laced up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NIce and warm
customer_reviews.text: These boots are nice and warm, I have a high arch and wide feet by the toes, they are roomy but i still need extra arch support if i want to use them on a hiking trip. Easy to put on and lace up.
customer_reviews.author: Minusita

customer_reviews.title: Very bulky boots
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. They were way too heavy and bulky looking for me. They were more like construction boots. They seemed well made and fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Zee R

customer_reviews.title: I loved this boot
customer_reviews.text: I loved this boot. I tried another Timberland style and didn't love them (The Kenningston). I think Timberland's work best when they look the most original Timberland way. The soft fleece just adds to the look. I am excited to wear these this Winter and Fall. This price is way better than the non fleece Timberland's.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 9.5 thinking with thick socks it would fit well but it was still too big. I can wear a 9-9.5 in most shoes. I wore 2 pair of socks and that helped. My feet were warm enough walking in freezing weather but the grip on the bottom was disappointing. I slipped on some ice that the others had no problem with and they all were wearing Columbia brand. The look of the boot is very nice and pairs well with jeans or leggings.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful _EvD

customer_reviews.title: The best !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Buffalo NY and we all know how cold and crappy our winters can be .. as well as unexpected massive snowstorms.. these by far are the best boots I ever worn!! Super comfortable keeps my feet extremely warm and the best part dry !!! I've owned so many different boots and nothing compares to tims. I'd highly recommend these to anyone who lives in cold states.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a size 8. 5 and received one ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 8.5 and received one boot in that size and the other in a size 7.5. Even if I would have received both boots in the right size I would have had to send them back because they were so narrow. I did get refunded very quickly though. I won't be reordering because of how narrow they were.
customer_reviews.author: ItalianSis

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes for the winter
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoes for the winter! I can walk as much as i want in the snow. I also used them sometimes as rain boots. They look cute with tights and skirts, they are comfortable, really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: So warm, cute, and waterproof!! These were a godsend when I was in Europe during the cold, rainy winter. Keeps you dry without looking ugly!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Reeder

customer_reviews.title: like this boots but if your size is 8 like ...
customer_reviews.text: like this boots but if your size is 8 like me, I suggest stay with that size I order 81/2 and is a little too big a least you wearing thick socks
customer_reviews.author: xtreme opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great-- careful with sizing
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted!! Beware though, I am a 7.5 in running shoes and I ordered a 7.5 in these shoes and they were somewhat small. If you like a little wiggle room I suggest to order a half size up. Other than sizing the shoes are great and stylish, perfect for the upcoming cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: MKC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, durable boots, but a little uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so cute. The first day I wore them I literally got at least 5 compliments. They are also very durable and definitely waterproof. I live in Michigan and have been wearing them in snowy/icy conditions. The only downside is that they are pretty difficult to get on and off, and they are very rigid so my foot isn't extremely comfortable in them. I am hoping this will go away as I break them in. I would recommend them but maybe get a wider size than normal - my foot feels squeezed (and I don't have this problem regularly with my shoes).
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Too large for a dress boot
customer_reviews.text: I normally where a 9 1/2 to a 10. The 10 was way cheaper when I ordered them, but they seemed huge on my feet. I also thought they looked larger like a real combat boot on my foot. I should have know with them being a winter boot. I ended up giving them to my mom for Christmas and she loves them. They are water proof which is a plus, just not what I wanted for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! I bought these as an alternative to "winter ...
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I bought these as an alternative to "winter boots" - such as a Sorel boot. I wanted a boot that looked like a regular shoe, but could give me the same functions as a winter boot. I did have to break them in a little bit, but once that's done they're golden! I live in Minnesota. I've been wearing these every day since I got them. They keep my feet warm, and I haven't slipped once. My favorite thing about them is probably how rugged they are. They can put up with a lot of abuse, and show no signs of it! I can tell these are going to last me a very long time. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Hilber

customer_reviews.title: Extremely uncomfortable. Fake timberlands
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this purchase. I think these are fake timberland boots. Very uncomfortable and the fit was too small and felt strange. I have the same pair in tan that I bought from Nordstrom which are extremely comfortable and fit perfectly. These boots are terrible. I do not recommend buying these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely fantastic quality. The boots are beautiful! Not 100% sure about fit yet, as they are a Christmas gift, but I was really impressed with the boots and the quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Gaddy

customer_reviews.title: Cute but no support!
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I have not tested them out on a big walking adventure yet. They have no support at all -an insert is a must for old people. I am 45. They have very heavy soles but I didn't mind that when walking. I have to agree they are slippery when wet, which is very strange for this type of shoe and they squeak when wet , which is super annoying. I will update my review after a trip to Europe next week!
customer_reviews.author: JennyS

customer_reviews.title: The fleece lining comes detached
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots, but after only 2 months wear, the fleece lining has come detached from the boot. It makes it very difficult to get it on.
customer_reviews.author: smoochy232

customer_reviews.title: Only good for tiny feet!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 times one my size a size 8 then a 9 and still they were super tight! This is Not for people with wide feet! Waste of my time!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: So cute. Fits great. Pretty true to size but for me personally they are SLIGHTLY wide. Not a big deal considering I live in the North east and will most likley be wearing big, thick socks with them, which is probably why they are designed this way. I ordered the taupe. Pictured shows one image with no flash, looking brown, and with flash on, looking slightly olive green. In reality, they are an in between of the two colors pictured. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: tricia wood

customer_reviews.title: First off I must say I LOVE Timberland and will forever and this purchase {that I ...
customer_reviews.text: First off I must say I LOVE Timberland and will forever and this purchase {that I disappointingly had to return} was the 1st pair ever in my 43years of living been disappointed in. Extremely narrow even buying a half size up than normally wear. Will purchase Timberland again- just not This pair.
customer_reviews.author: A.J & Tammy Moscato

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present!
customer_reviews.text: Yes!! Get them! If you are looking for boots and all you know are uggs, then you really need to get these boots! For one the name! Remember, now days women only look and care for brand names, second, the color and also the style, they look pretty and also comfy! Trust me, my friend loves them and a lot of people always tell her about the boots!
customer_reviews.author: MONTYHADES

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I love the versatility of wearing them all the way up or folded over. I didn't think I'd like them folded over too much, but this has become the primary way of wearing them. They are waterproof and have great treads. Perfect for the Oregon winters. My only complaint is that the teddy fleece starts to get dirty after awhile. I'm not sure how to fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandri Chiavetta

customer_reviews.title: If your feet are wide like mine, there's no way you'll be comfortable in ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally I'm 6.5 in boots, I got these in a 6. Really could've gotten a 5.5, unfortunately they don't have them anymore. If your feet are wide like mine, there's no way you'll be comfortable in a regular. You must get W. I got a 6 W, and they're still snug. I hope I can break them looser a little. Overall they're good. They look a little boy - ish, and rugged, I'm still intimidating to wear them as I'm a skinny little girl, but I'm sure as winter will hit I'll take em out. I don't know about warmness, but one thing I can say is that they RUN BIG & SNUG. so keep that in mind
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Andrian

customer_reviews.title: Watch your Width
customer_reviews.text: These boots are nice but only fit if I didn't wear a sock with them. Very narrow, took about 15minutes to squash my foot in wearing a thin sock so I returned them. I wear a 9 1/2 medium in most things but not these. I must say they were nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: BigFan In MO.

customer_reviews.title: durable brown boots for cold, for rain
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, warm brown boot that I like to wear fully laced up. Haha, I have such a thing for brown shoes. My first time wearing a chunkier shoe and it is great for traversing rain puddle days and for December when I travelled to Washington D.C. Also my first time wearing a lace-up boot and I don't mind tying them up or loosening them. My feet are wide due to bunions from running (I got the wide size), so walking around in these boots in D.C. every night for a week, my feet got sore. They are more broken in by now and I am satisfied with these boots. Good job, Timberland.
customer_reviews.author: V.

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: I love love these boots. I’ve had them for over a year now and they are great
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Murry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great! They are super cute, have great tread and are very warm. I've been wearing them for a few months now and they have held up excellently. However, I have been careful to treat the bottom half of them with mink oil regularly to make sure they stay waterproof. The only thing to watch out for is that the suede on the top is not easy to clean-- so make sure to get any mud off them straight away!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Larter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cozy comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I love timberland boots. These are like awesome fuzzy slippers. And the fact that they are fold down style makes them so easy to put one. I have gotten more compliments on them than any of my Timberlands.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanmarie

customer_reviews.title: Warm and fashionable
customer_reviews.text: Boots look just like the picture and fit great. They're warm too. Only down fall is that the light color gets scuffed and dirty very easily. My daughter loves the color though so if she had to do it again she wouldn't get a darker color.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica P

customer_reviews.title: I have had foot problems for years (bunions) and it has been so hard to find something that feels good for more than an hour or
customer_reviews.text: 60 years old just trying Timberland boots . Oh what a fool I have been in waiting so long ! I have had foot problems for years (bunions) and it has been so hard to find something that feels good for more than an hour or two . This is my 2nd pair of Timberland boots and my feet are in heaven all day with this brand . I will purchase more for sure as I also love the look of so many Timberland styles .
customer_reviews.author: seeker56

customer_reviews.title: Boots in poor condition. Look as tho they've been worn( not ...
customer_reviews.text: Boots in poor condition. Look as tho they've been worn( not outside, but around somewhere). Visible seams inside one boot- which would be fine if they weren't supposed to fold down. Stain on the fur inside of the same boot. Also what look like grass or mulch pieces. Other boots tongue looks work, and there are already creases on the boot where it looks like it's been turned down several time. Very odd too see such poor craftsmanship from Timberland, and poor quality control from amazon. These should have been checked before sent to a customer. Time to only order shoes from Zappos
customer_reviews.author: Kristin DiPietro

customer_reviews.title: stylish, waterproof and warm
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my daughter as winter boots for campus in the snowbelt. the are a bit snug but should stretch. she has not taken them off- they are both stylish and functional and she loves them. it was also nice to get them a little cheaper than anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: heidiw

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but foot could not get into the boot easily.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been comfortable. except the tongue is stitched so as to not open all the way and my foot could not get into the boot easily.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Lowy

customer_reviews.title: The coating scratches off very easily. I was hoping they would be better quality ...
customer_reviews.text: The coating scratches off very easily. I was hoping they would be better quality and able to handle scuffs/scratches for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The run real size not like other reviews says they run small size!! Order the size you normally wear!
customer_reviews.text: The boots are beautiful! But the reviews about size were a bit confusobg , because most of them said the boot ran in biger size therfor i ordered a smaller size than the one i usualy wear and i was wrong. They seem to run true to the siZe so order the size you normally wear. I wear a 7 and oredered a 6 based on reviews and they were too small. I had to give them to a friend .
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Good at snowing day only
customer_reviews.text: It was good to wear in a snowing day, but I will not recommend it. It is kinda heavy. It is not a good feminine looking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: ... in the winter they are water proof which is great. Got them for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy in the winter they are water proof which is great. Got them for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the fit and look of it
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the fit and look of it. after breaking in though, the fleece lining does get a little flat, so I had to wear thick socks or double layer two pairs of socks to fill in the gaps between my feet and the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: OLO

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Chicago winter
customer_reviews.text: These are well made very comfortable boots, also good at keeping my feet warm and dry in another cold Chicago winter. The only problems I've had is that the boots must be almost completely unlaced in order get my foot down past the narrowest ankle part of the boot. The fit, however, is fine and I'm able to wear a pair of thick socks with them without the boots feeling tight.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Rodiek

customer_reviews.title: Favorite boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They fit great, are great quality and look awesome.
customer_reviews.author: A&C

customer_reviews.title: It's not you; it's me
customer_reviews.text: It's not the boots;it's me. We just weren't made for each other. The boots are excellent quality and fit as I expected width and length but were just too domed heightwise for me. I wanted something sleeker so I did return them.
customer_reviews.author: NancyOwenSwain

customer_reviews.title: Size down a half
customer_reviews.text: They seem super warm & cozy for the short time I tried them on. I am returning my size 7.5 to re-purchase a size 7. I wear a 7.5 in all my other shoes. The 7.5 even LOOKED too large on my foot; looked like I was trying on someone else's boots.
customer_reviews.author: mallerie mohns

customer_reviews.title: Large and Stiff
customer_reviews.text: These boot seemed like they would be great for winter weather, but they were too large even with boot socks. They are stiff, and I think that it would have taken some time to break these in. I usually wear a 9 in boots, but these were just too big. One size smaller would have been too small.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots. I sized up. I'm a 7.5 and I got the 8. I put an insole in them. They're a tad large but I was expecting that. When worn with the insole and thick socks, they fit just right. And they look super awesome.
customer_reviews.author: A. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots!! I normally wear a size 7. I bought these in a size 7 Regular. They were too big. So, I returned them for a size 6.5 Regular and those fit perfect. Love the color. Very warm, insulated, waterproof and very stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Moses

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and solid shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shoes for my wife. She usually wears a 37, and I intended to buy a 38 in order to have enough space also with thick socks in the shoes. When it arrived (btw, a very quick delivery from US to Switzerland!) I saw it was a size 6 = EU 37. Anyway, it fits quite good - knowing/hoping that the leather will widen a little bit while wearing the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Manz

customer_reviews.title: overall good but a little bit invisible leak
customer_reviews.text: It is water proof, but during rainy days, I guess there is a small crack or something that allows small amount of water to get into both shoes and my socks would be slightly wet....
customer_reviews.author: Zhang Gexue

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Practical to Boot!
customer_reviews.text: Can't rave about these enough. I was skeptical but they ARE really waterproof! I bought these last minute for a trip to Iceland and have never looked back! They were warm and comfy and had pretty good traction. I've received multiple compliments and recommend them all the time! For the price, how could you not buy these! You'll love them.
customer_reviews.author: nashkar

product_meta.title: Timberland Women's Teddy Fleece Fold-Down Waterproof Boot
feature_bullets: Lace-up ankle boot featuring fold-over shaft with fleece lining
Rubber lug outsole for durability and traction on any surface
EVA midsole for all-day comfort and cushioning
